Dear Colleagues and Students,

The recent spate of confrontations and unrest have left many Hong Kong people shocked. After all these confrontations, we should allow things to settle, take stock of what has happened and reflect upon the way forward. Among the many views expressed, I believe most would agree that continued confrontations and the use of violence will not in any way help resolve the current impasse plaguing Hong Kong. I also believe that we must have the courage to address the existing social tensions and their causes.

Personally, I feel disheartened to see the rift in society. I appeal to all sectors to start a genuine, rational dialogue with mutual respect, having due regard to the long-term well-being of Hong Kong. To this end, it is crucial for the Government to take the lead and to sincerely listen to the voices and aspirations of Hong Kong people. Each and every one of us has a role to play, and we should do whatever possible in the best interests of the place we call home.

By putting the confrontations behind us, it is my sincere hope that we can make a new start through acceptance.

Professor Stephen Y.L. Cheung
President
4 July 2019

各位同事、同學︰



近期社會發生的衝擊和動盪，對香港帶來莫大的震撼。衝突過後，大家是時候冷靜下來，沉澱整理，反思香港未來的前路。綜合各方意見，我相信大家均認同持續的衝擊、暴力和對立無助解決當前困局；我們亦不能迴避背後的社會矛盾以及成因。



生於斯，長於斯，對於當前社會出現的撕裂，我實在感到痛心。此時此刻，我呼籲各界平心靜氣展開對話之門，以理性及彼此尊重方式開展溝通。政府應採取主動，用最大的誠意聆聽市民的訴求和心聲，以香港長遠福祉為依歸。作為香港的一分子，一切對香港有利的事情，我們都應該考慮，並盡力去做。



我深盼香港可以重新出發，以接納代替對立。



校長

張仁良教授

2019年7月4日

Dear Colleagues and Students,



It was with great sadness that I learned the heartbreaking news of the passing of our student Lo Hiu-yan yesterday, who was a Year 1 music major of our Bachelor of Arts (Honours) in Creative Arts and Culture (CCA) programme. Apart from immediately activating the University’s crisis response mechanism, I paid a visit to Hiu-yan’s parents just now together with colleagues from CCA and the Student Affairs Office (SAO) to extend our sincere condolences. The University will offer all the necessary support and assistance to help them tide over this difficult period.



As the President, I am gravely concerned about the challenges and stress that students and youngsters are facing these days. Life is precious, and I hope you can all brave difficulties, big and small, with positivity and resilience. Please lend your ears to your friends and fellow classmates, show your care, and support each other. For those who need emotional support, please call SAO’s 24-hour hotline (Tel: 8208 1155) or its counselling centre (Tel: 2948 6245) during office hours.



At this time of grief, our prayers and hearts go to Hiu-yan’s family members and friends!



Professor Stephen Y.L. Cheung

President

30 June 2019



各位同事、同學：



相信大家已經得悉，創意藝術與文化榮譽文學士課程（主修音樂）的一年級學生盧曉欣，昨日下午離我們而去。作為校長，我感到十分悲痛難過。校方已即時啟動危機處理機制應變，我和學系以及學生事務處的同事，亦剛探望過曉欣的家人，表達我們的慰問。校方將提供一切可行的支援，冀助他們度過這個困難時刻。



我明白學生和年青人正面對不少的挑戰和困擾。生命誠可貴，我希望大家能以正面的態度面對生活中可能出現的種種困難。此時此刻，我亦希望大家能多關心身邊的同學和友伴，多聆聽他們的需要，互相支持。同學如需情緒支援，亦可致電校方24小時熱線（電話：8208 1155），又或於辦公時間內，與學生事務處輔導中心的同事聯絡（電話：2948 6245）。



在這個艱難的時刻，我們心繫盧同學的家人和朋友，亦希望大家節哀順變。



校長

張仁良教授

2019年6月30日
